trans-unit.source:
\n

Provides attributes for files and directories.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file is a candidate for backup or removal.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file is compressed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reserved for future use.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file is a directory.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file or directory is encrypted.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: For a file, this means that all data in the file is encrypted.
trans-unit.target: Xxx x xxxx$ xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
For a directory, this means that encryption is the default for newly created files and directories.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx x xxxxxxxxx$ xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file is hidden, and thus is not included in an ordinary directory listing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxx$ xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file or directory includes data integrity support.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: When this value is applied to a file, all data streams in the file have integrity support.
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx x xxxx$ xxx xxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
When this value is applied to a directory, all new files and subdirectories within that directory, by default, include integrity support.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx$ xxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file is a standard file that has no special attributes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This attribute is valid only if it is used alone.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xx xx xx xxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file or directory is excluded from the data integrity scan.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
When this value is applied to a directory, by default, all new files and subdirectories within that directory are excluded from data integrity.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file will not be indexed by the operating system's content indexing service.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$x xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file is offline.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The data of the file is not immediately available.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file is read-only.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxx$xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file contains a reparse point, which is a block of user-defined data associated with a file or a directory.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx x xxxxxxx xxxxx$ xxxxx xx x xxxxx xx xxxx$xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file is a sparse file.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
Sparse files are typically large files whose data consists of mostly zeros.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file is a system file.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
That is, the file is part of the operating system or is used exclusively by the operating system.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xx$ xxx xxxx xx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The file is temporary.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: A temporary file contains data that is needed while an application is executing but is not needed after the application is finished.
trans-unit.target: X xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: File systems try to keep all the data in memory for quicker access rather than flushing the data back to mass storage.
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
A temporary file should be deleted by the application as soon as it is no longer needed.

\n
trans-unit.target: X xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xx xx xx xx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x
